name: gitlab
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing GitLab resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`gitlab` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-gitlab).

cacertFile.description: A file containing the ca certificate to use in case ssl certificate is not from a standard chain

clientCert.description: File path to client certificate when GitLab instance is behind company proxy. File must contain PEM encoded data.

clientKey.description: File path to client key when GitLab instance is behind company proxy. File must contain PEM encoded data.

insecure.description: Disable SSL verification of API calls

token.description: The OAuth token used to connect to GitLab.

groupAccessLevel.description:
Group's sharing permissions. See [group members permission][group_members_permissions] for more info.
Valid values are `guest`, `reporter`, `developer`, `master`.

groupId.description: Group id of the group you want to share the project with.

approvalsBeforeMerge.description: The numbers of approvals needed in a merge requests.

httpUrlToRepo.description: The HTTP clone URL of the project.

jobsEnabled.description: Whether pipelines are enabled for the project.

nameWithNamespace.description: In `group / subgroup / project` or `user / project` format.

sshUrlToRepo.description: The SSH clone URL of the project.

statistics.description: Include project statistics. Cannot be used with `group_id`.

tagLists.description: A set of the project topics (formerly called "project tags").

httpUrlToRepo.description: The HTTP clone URL of the project.

nameWithNamespace.description: In `group / subgroup / project` or `user / project` format.

groupId.description: The ID of the group owned by the authenticated user to look projects for within. Cannot be used with `min_access_level`, `with_programming_language` or `statistics`.

avatarUrl.description: The avatar URL of the user.

canCreateGroup.description: Whether the user can create groups.

canCreateProject.description: Whether the user can create projects.

createdAt.description: Date the user was created at.

email.description: The e-mail address of the user.

externUid.description: Lookup users by external UID. (Requires administrator privileges)

id.description: The unique id assigned to the user by the gitlab server.

isAdmin.description: Whether the user is an admin.

projectsLimit.description: Number of projects the user can create.

provider.description: The UID provider of the user.

state.description: Whether the user is active or blocked.

twoFactorEnabled.description: Whether user's two factor auth is enabled.

provider.description:
The provider type for the gitlab package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

clientCert.description: File path to client certificate when GitLab instance is behind company proxy. File must contain PEM encoded data.

clientKey.description: File path to client key when GitLab instance is behind company proxy. File must contain PEM encoded data.

insecure.description: Disable SSL verification of API calls

token.description: The OAuth token used to connect to GitLab.

project.description: The id of the project.

project.description: The id of the project.

pushAccessLevel.description: One of five levels of access to the project.

project.description: The name or id of the project to add the deploy key to.

title.description: A title to describe the deploy key with.

Boolean, defaults to true.  Whether to enable LFS
support for projects in this group.

parentId.description: Integer, id of the parent group (creates a nested group).

requestAccessEnabled.description:
Boolean, defaults to false.  Whether to
enable users to request access to the group.

runnersToken.description: The group level registration token to use during runner setup.

visibilityLevel.description:
Set to `public` to create a public group.
Valid values are `private`, `internal`, `public`.
Groups are created as private by default.

Groups are created as private by default.

gitlab:index/groupCluster:GroupCluster.description:
This resource allows you to create and manage group clusters for your GitLab groups.
For further information on clusters, consult the [gitlab
documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ce/user/group/clusters/index.html).


{{% examples %}}
## Example Usage
{{% example %}}

```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as gitlab from "@pulumi/gitlab";

const foo = new gitlab.Group("foo", {
    path: "foo-path",
});
const bar = new gitlab.GroupCluster("bar", {
    domain: "example.com",
    enabled: true,
    environmentScope: "*",
    group: foo.id,
    kubernetesApiUrl: "https://124.124.124",
    kubernetesAuthorizationType: "rbac",
    kubernetesCaCert: "some-cert",
    kubernetesToken: "some-token",
    managementClusterId: "123456",
});
```
```python
import pulumi
import pulumi_gitlab as gitlab

foo = gitlab.Group("foo", path="foo-path")
bar = gitlab.GroupCluster("bar",
    domain="example.com",
    enabled=True,
    environment_scope="*",
    group=foo.id,
    kubernetes_api_url="https://124.124.124",
    kubernetes_authorization_type="rbac",
    kubernetes_ca_cert="some-cert",
    kubernetes_token="some-token",
    management_cluster_id="123456")
```
{{% /example %}}
{{% /examples %}}

domain.description: The base domain of the cluster.

enabled.description: Determines if cluster is active or not. Defaults to `true`. This attribute cannot be read.

environmentScope.description: The associated environment to the cluster. Defaults to `*`.

group.description: The id of the group to add the cluster to.

kubernetesApiUrl.description: The URL to access the Kubernetes API.

kubernetesAuthorizationType.description: The cluster authorization type. Valid values are `rbac`, `abac`, `unknown_authorization`. Defaults to `rbac`.

kubernetesCaCert.description: TLS certificate (needed if API is using a self-signed TLS certificate).

kubernetesToken.description: The token to authenticate against Kubernetes.

managed.description: Determines if cluster is managed by gitlab or not. Defaults to `true`. This attribute cannot be read.

domain.description: The base domain of the cluster.

enabled.description: Determines if cluster is active or not. Defaults to `true`. This attribute cannot be read.

issuesEnabled.description: Enable issue tracking for the project.

mergeMethod.description:
Set to `ff` to create fast-forward merges
Valid values are `merge`, `rebase_merge`, `ff`
Repositories are created with `merge` by default

mergeRequestsEnabled.description: Enable merge requests for the project.

namespaceId.description:
The namespace (group or user) of the project. Defaults to your user.
See `gitlab.Group` for an example.

onlyAllowMergeIfPipelineSucceeds.description: Set to true if you want allow merges only if a pipeline succeeds.

removeSourceBranchAfterMerge.description: Enable `Delete source branch` option by default for all new merge requests.

requestAccessEnabled.description: Allow users to request member access.

runnersToken.description: Registration token to use during runner setup.

sharedRunnersEnabled.description: Enable shared runners for this project.

sharedWithGroups.description: Enable sharing the project with a list of groups (maps).

repository via SSH.

visibilityLevel.description:

Repositories are created as private by default.

gitlab:index/projectCluster:ProjectClust.description:
This resource allows you to create and manage project clusters for your GitLab projects.
For further information on clusters, consult the [gitlab
documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ce/user/project/clusters/index.html).


{{% examples %}}
## Example Usage
{{% example %}}

```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as gitlab from "@pulumi/gitlab";

const foo = new gitlab.Project("foo", {});
const bar = new gitlab.ProjectCluster("bar", {
    domain: "example.com",
    enabled: true,
    environmentScope: "*",
    kubernetesApiUrl: "https://124.124.124",
    kubernetesAuthorizationType: "rbac",
    kubernetesCaCert: "some-cert",
    kubernetesNamespace: "namespace",
    kubernetesToken: "some-token",
    managementClusterId: "123456",
    project: foo.id,
});
```
```python
import pulumi
import pulumi_gitlab as gitlab

foo = gitlab.Project("foo")
bar = gitlab.ProjectCluster("bar",
    domain="example.com",
    enabled=True,
    environment_scope="*",
    kubernetes_api_url="https://124.124.124",
    kubernetes_authorization_type="rbac",
    kubernetes_ca_cert="some-cert",
    kubernetes_namespace="namespace",
    kubernetes_token="some-token",
    management_cluster_id="123456",
    project=foo.id)
```
{{% /example %}}
{{% /examples %}}

domain.description: The base domain of the cluster.

enabled.description: Determines if cluster is active or not. Defaults to `true`. This attribute cannot be read.

environmentScope.description: The associated environment to the cluster. Defaults to `*`.

kubernetesApiUrl.description: The URL to access the Kubernetes API.

kubernetesAuthorizationType.description: The cluster authorization type. Valid values are `rbac`, `abac`, `unknown_authorization`. Defaults to `rbac`.

kubernetesCaCert.description: TLS certificate (needed if API is using a self-signed TLS certificate).

kubernetesNamespace.description: The unique namespace related to the project.

kubernetesToken.description: The token to authenticate against Kubernetes.

managed.description: Determines if cluster is managed by gitlab or not. Defaults to `true`. This attribute cannot be read.

project.description: The id of the project to add the cluster to.

gitlab:index/projectPushRules:ProjectPus.description:
This resource allows you to create and manage push rules for your GitLab projects.
For further information on push rules, consult the [gitlab
documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ce/push_rules/push_rules.html#push-rules).

authorEmailRegex.description: All commit author emails must match this regex, e.g. "@my-company.com$"

branchNameRegex.description: All branch names must match this regex, e.g. "(feature|hotfix)\/*"

commitMessageRegex.description: All commit messages must match this regex, e.g. "Fixed \d+\..*"

fileNameRegex.description: All commited filenames must not match this regex, e.g. "(jar|exe)$"

memberCheck.description: Restrict commits by author (email) to existing GitLab users

preventSecrets.description: GitLab will reject any files that are likely to contain secrets

project.description: The name or id of the project to add the push rules to.

protected.description: If set to `true`, the variable will be passed only to pipelines running on protected branches and tags. Defaults to `false`.

commentOnEventEnabled.description: Enable comments inside Jira issues on each GitLab event (commit / merge request)

jiraIssueTransitionId.description: The ID of a transition that moves issues to a closed state. You can find this number under the JIRA workflow administration (Administration > Issues > Workflows) by selecting View under Operations of the desired workflow of your project. By default, this ID is set to 2.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getGroup.

fullPath.description: The full path of the group.

fullName.description: The full name of the group.

fullPath.description: The full path of the group.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

lfsEnabled.description: Boolean, is LFS enabled for projects in this group.

parentId.description: Integer, ID of the parent group.

requestAccessEnabled.description: Boolean, is request for access enabled to the group.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getProject.

archived.description: Whether the project is in read-only mode (archived).

defaultBranch.description: The default branch for the project.

httpUrlToRepo.description:
URL that can be provided to `git clone` to clone the
repository via HTTP.

id.description: The integer that uniquely identifies the project within the gitlab install.

issuesEnabled.description: Enable issue tracking for the project.

mergeRequestsEnabled.description: Enable merge requests for the project.

namespaceId.description:
The namespace (group or user) of the project. Defaults to your user.
See `gitlab.Group` for an example.

removeSourceBranchAfterMerge.description: Enable `Delete source branch` option by default for all new merge requests

requestAccessEnabled.description: Allow users to request member access.

runnersToken.description: Registration token to use during runner setup.

sshUrlToRepo.description:
URL that can be provided to `git clone` to clone the
repository via SSH.

visibilityLevel.description: Repositories are created as private by default.

webUrl.description: URL that can be used to find the project in a browser.

defaultBranch.description: The default branch for the project.

repository via HTTP.

issuesEnabled.description: Enable issue tracking for the project.

mergeRequestsEnabled.description: Enable merge requests for the project.

The namespace (group or user) of the project. Defaults to your user.
See `gitlab.Group` for an example.

runnersToken.description: Registration token to use during runner setup.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getProjects.

groupId.description: The ID of the group owned by the authenticated user to look projects for within. Cannot be used with `min_access_level`, `with_programming_language` or `statistics`.

includeSubgroups.description: Include projects in subgroups of this group. Default is `false`. Needs `group_id`.

maxQueryablePages.description: Prevents overloading your Gitlab instance in case of a misconfiguration. Default is `10`.

membership.description: Limit by projects that the current user is a member of.

minAccessLevel.description: Limit to projects where current user has at least this access level, refer to the [official documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/members.html) for values. Cannot be used with `group_id`.

orderBy.description: Return projects ordered by `id`, `name`, `path`, `created_at`, `updated_at`, or `last_activity_at` fields. Default is `created_at`.

owned.description: Limit by projects owned by the current user.

search.description: Return list of authorized projects matching the search criteria.

simple.description: Return only the ID, URL, name, and path of each project.

sort.description: Return projects sorted in `asc` or `desc` order. Default is `desc`.

starred.description: Limit by projects starred by the current user.

statistics.description: Include project statistics. Cannot be used with `group_id`.

withCustomAttributes.description: Include custom attributes in response _(admins only)_.

withIssuesEnabled.description: Limit by projects with issues feature enabled. Default is `false`.

withMergeRequestsEnabled.description: Limit by projects with merge requests feature enabled. Default is `false`.

withProgrammingLanguage.description: Limit by projects which use the given programming language. Cannot be used with `group_id`.

withShared.description: Include projects shared to this group. Default is `true`. Needs `group_id`.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getProjects.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

projects.description: A list containing the projects matching the supplied arguments

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getUser.

email.description: The e-mail address of the user. (Requires administrator privileges)

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getUser.

avatarUrl.description: The avatar URL of the user.

canCreateGroup.description: Whether the user can create groups.

canCreateProject.description: Whether the user can create projects.

createdAt.description: Date the user was created at.

email.description: The e-mail address of the user.

externUid.description: The external UID of the user.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

isAdmin.description: Whether the user is an admin.

projectsLimit.description: Number of projects the user can create.

state.description: Whether the user is active or blocked.

twoFactorEnabled.description: Whether user's two factor auth is enabled.

userProvider.description: The UID provider of the user.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getUsers.

createdAfter.description: Search for users created after a specific date. (Requires administrator privileges)

createdBefore.description: Search for users created before a specific date. (Requires administrator privileges)

externProvider.description: Lookup users by external provider. (Requires administrator privileges)

externUid.description: Lookup users by external UID. (Requires administrator privileges)

orderBy.description: Order the users' list by `id`, `name`, `username`, `created_at` or `updated_at`. (Requires administrator privileges)

search.description: Search users by username, name or email.

sort.description: Sort users' list in asc or desc order. (Requires administrator privileges)

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getUsers.

externUid.description: The external UID of the user.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing GitLab resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-gitlab)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi/pulumi-gitlab` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-gitlab/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-providers/terraform-provider-gitlab` repo](https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-gitlab/issues).
